Title: Manchester marathon for the trussel trust

Description:
Cyril, aged 6, decided to shave his head for the 'Trussell Trust' which is a vital food bank for people who are struggling financially. So many more people are struggling in these hard times.

I thought I'd keep him company and shave my head...again! 

Last time I did this was 2015 when my oldest, Olive, was nearly 3 and Cyril was 18 months. My youngest, Maud, is now 2 and a half. I raised £5000 for Cancer Research, as a joint effort with a friend, and donated my hair to 'The Little Princess Trust' who make wigs for children that have lost their hair due to cancer treatments.

I hope to donate to The Little Princess Trust again when they are up and running again. Blonde hair this time!

I am not expecting to raise anything near £5000 this time due to the current financial worries a lot of people will be faced with.

If all this does is save me from the worst root regrowth then so be it! 

Some people said bald suited me last time- it didn't and certainly doesn't this time as I am fatter, paler and older!

We are asking for anyone who can spare anything at all to donate to this worthy cause please and/or 'Share' as much as you can on any social media! 

Thank you,

Cyril and Claire. xxx
Title: Cyril and Mummy's head shave

Description: Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I’m not running a marathon or doing anything heroic like that, I just want to try to raise a bit of money to support The Trussell Trust, the UK’s main food bank charity, because I believe coronavirus panic buying at supermarkets by people who can financially afford to panic buy is wiping supermarket shelves clean of even the absolute basic essentials that people less fortunate than many of us can barely afford anyway. If you yourself have a few quid to spare, please help. What’s £10? A packet of fags or a takeaway pizza. Please help stop the Coronavirus Poverty Gap.
Title: Jonathan's Stop The Coronavirus Poverty Gap

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page. The North Hampshire Downs youth usually join with the rest of United Youth to take part in The big Sleep Out in Winchester. This has been cancelled this year, so we are going to have our own Big Sleep In! We will be setting up camp in our living rooms, and then taking part in fun activities with each other via Zoom. Helen's just happy she won't have water dripping onto her nose this year!

You can support us via this page (all funds will go directly to the Odiham Food bank, run by the church in collaboration with Hart Foodbank.

Title: THE STAY SAFE SHOW

Description:
In this period of Coronavirus lockdown there is increased pressure on the food banks for a variety of reasons:-

  • Unexpected job losses and increase in demand for supplies.
  • Regular donators being on lockdown.
  • Supermarket restrictions on purchasing multiple items.
  • Closure of many community buildings which act as drop off points for donations.

There is an amazing team of people working in the Bromley warehouse and in the centres, but they can only work with what has been donated.

Last year, food banks in their network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, they can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

I am hoping that I can help to raise funds to help them to keep supporting those that need them in the community.

I will buzz cut my hair to No. 6 all over if my full target is met. If I don't meet the target I should still like to keep your donations and would be happy to sport a suitable haircut commensurate with the amount raised - the more money, the more extreme. If I smash my target it could be a No 5 or shorter!!!

Please help.
Title: Miss Denton's 'Head Shave' Challenge

Description:
August 2021 update: I’ll be riding a 5-day bike tour around southern England, starting with a loop around the North Downs, then riding from Guildford to Salisbury, the New Forest, Portsmouth, round the Isle of Wight and back to Guildford. After such generous sponsorship last year, I’m not pushing for it this time but there remains great need for the Trussell Trust food banks, even more so now with supermarket shortages and Brexit price rises. So if you’ve made it here, please consider a kind donation while I ride with a strapped-up hamstring!

______________________________________________________

To mark turning 50, I’ve been planning to cycle the story of my life, from where I was born, Guisborough in the North Riding of Yorkshire, via all the places in this country I’ve lived in – taking in Kirby, Oxford, Reading, Guildford, Reigate and London – to end in Cambridge.

It was just going to be a personal challenge to mark a significant milestone. However, having spent my 50th birthday in the pandemic lockdown, I wanted to turn the bike tour into a chance to raise money for the Trussell Trust, whose food banks so many people rely on and which sadly is in even greater demand now as the severe economic hardship for many during this crisis intensifies.

I will be setting off on Sunday 19th July. I’ll provide updates throughout the bike tour on my dedicated Twitter account: https://twitter.com/phil50biketour

Thank you for anything you are able to give to help the Trussell Trust help those who most need it.

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, the Trussell Trust can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Description:
Inspired by other similar charity events I have decided to complete my staircase version of the three peaks challenge. Anyone who knows me will be familiar with my love of the mountains, obviously I can’t get out there at the moment, so I have decided to climb the equivalent combined  height of the highest peaks in Scotland, Wales and England (not Britain’s there highest peaks - they're all in Scotland). I’m trying to raise money for the Trussel Trust who provide much needed food banks across the country, sadly needed at the best of times but even more important at this time of crisis. Please help me.

I need to ascend 15,660 steps in total. That’s 1205 times up and down the stairs.

Scafell Pike 4500 steps, Snowdon 4610 steps, Ben Nevis 6550 steps.

Title: David's isolation cut - hair to impress!

Description:
I'm taking part in the Stay At Home Sleepout to raise funds for people who are homeless and in poverty. The money raised will go towards supporting local food banks that help the homeless and vulnerable gain access to vital supplies.

Now more than ever there are millions of people relying on food banks to help feed themselves and their family, if you are in a position to help I would love if you could donate to help support the cause! 

What I'm actually doing:

Come 8PM June 1st I will be taking up residence in my back garden until the following morning, sleeping out in a sleeping bag. I am hoping that it doesn't rain otherwise it will be a very soggy experience indeed, however, even if it did, I have the luxury of going back inside the following morning, having a hot meal and a bath whereas the people we are hoping to help do not, they have no home. 

Anyone that knows me knows I hate shadowy places and things that go bump in the night so sleeping outside without the comfort of a tent is so not my thing! I will be posting updates throughout the night and hopefully be able to raise some money to help those in need! 

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page :)
Title: CEO Sleepout

Description:
Not to be out done by the famous Jake’s May 5k A Day  fundraising effort (aka Mr Andrew from Midsomer Norton Primary School) I’ve decided to join him by climbing my stairs at home 100 hundred times everyday throughout May. At the very least I should be able to egg him on... He’s quite competitive don’t you know.

See daily themed(!) updates by visiting Midsomer Norton Primary School and Nursery’s Facebook page.

Update 5th May. Thank you for everybody’s support to help me reach my original goal of £300. Still 26 days to go so I’ve increased the target to £500.

Please share!
Title: Alun's 100 stairs a day challenge

Description:
We have decided to have some fun, put down our screens and raise money for a well deserving cause. 

We are swimming 21 miles (33.8km) in our garden pool, that’s 5200 lengths. We are currently 7.7kms from Dover (virtually of course!) and we plan to reach Calais by the end of May!

We know we are a very fortunate family of four so we have decided to raise money for the Trussell Trust, who provide much needed food and basic supplies to families across the UK from their network of over 1,200 food banks.

The Trussell Trust

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. Description:
In these unprecedented times, food banks will be more important than ever. Children that would have relied on free school meals may not receive them, thousands will lose jobs, and food poverty will undoubtedly rise. I've had my beloved beard for over five years and I've forgotten what my own face looks like. If I raise £200, I'll shave it off (and my girlfriend has agreed she can't leave me).

Trussell Trust's story:

Title: Sion's Shaving the Beard for Trussell Trust

Description:
“ No human should go to sleep without food “

We are two typical 15 year olds. We enjoy activities such as gaming, watching Netflix and hanging out with friends. However COVID-19 has changed everything around us, which also meant that we could not meet  each other and our friends in lockdown. This period of uncertainty made us realise that there are so many people out there who are not as fortunate as us, cannot even afford food and  starving for days ! These people need our urgent help in this Pandemic.

This is why we have decided to challenge ourselves to walk 40 km in a single day from Bourne End  to Reading on weekend of 25th July.

We have chosen to raise money for “The  Trussel trust “. We believe that they are the right organisation to help the hungry in these difficult times.

We would be very grateful if you can make a difference in their lives by supporting us on this  journey and save many lives  as every penny counts and every little helps. Thank you for reading our story and we hope you can help this noble cause. !

“ There is  no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up “ very powerful line by John Holmes.

Thanks and regards

Sarth and Aditya
Title: Sarth and Aditya 40 KM walk

Description:
In this time of unprecedented crisis, many have lost their livelihoods and income meaning food security has become an even greater concern within our community and food banks are vital. 

In an effort to fundraise for The Trussell Trust food bank network I will be shaving my head and donating my hair to the Little Princess Trust who provide free, real hair wigs to children with hair loss and fund crucial research into childhood cancers. 

Unfortunately, given the current situation, the Little Princess Trust are understandably unable to receive hair donations and I won’t be able to shave my head until they can. 

However, considering the recent enforcements made to prevent virus spread, food aid is needed urgently and any donations, no matter the size, will be greatly appreciated by myself, The Trussell Trust and any person relying on food banks to stay safe and fed in this trying time. Even £2 can make a difference x

Description:
Action Hands is a community campaign launched during COVID19 by London Nursery Schools (LNS) founder Sara Brennan, Amanda Frolich and Alison Wheeler to support the well being of young children and families through music and play. 

With this song "Time To Shine", The Action Hands team is raising funds for the Trussell Trust to provide food for families in need during COVID19. 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Action Hands

There are several great efforts going on to raise money for the NHS charities, so I thought i’d go with something that is local to many of my friends and colleagues - this is the area right next to Dell Glasgow (remember that place!?)

Challenge is simple (but not easy!) & for the golfers out there, but anyone can try it!

Just like several similar challenges, the golfer needs to get 20 balls, place a bucket, basin or plant pot etc. 10 feet away. Film yourself hitting all 20 and for everyone you get in the bucket - donate (a minimum) of £2.00 to the just giving page below.

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/carlo-cocozza

If you are tagged in this, you are nominated 😉 good luck!

Eg get 1 out of 20, donate £2 (or whatever you choose).
Get none in, donate at least £2 anyway. Every ‘ball in the bucket’ could be a meal for someone.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Since 2012 the FoodBank have been supporting people from Kingsbridge, Salcombe and the surrounding parishes.  

As a direct result of Covid-19 the area we cover has grown to Kingsbridge, Salcombe, Modbury and the surrounding 26 parishes....

As October ends there is still NO normal!!
It looks like there is going to be a second period of lock-down which will affect so many of our local families and individuals and the number of Covid cases IS slowly increasing.

We really need to stick together as a community, to make sure that everyone who needs help CAN access it, easily.
The FoodBank have been assisting local residents since March with Food, Prescriptions, Shopping and other errands. 

It's really starting to look like Christmas is going to be VERY different from any other! We're asking for your help to limit the impact on the most vulnerable people in our society in the run up and over the school holidays.

Title: Gerrie's preparing for the end of the Furlough Scheme and a possible 2nd lock-down

Description:
We have been blown away by the kindness, generosity and support to Ben and for this important local charity.

5-year-old Ben was diagnosed with Nance-Horan Syndrome, an extremely rare genetic disease, at just 2 weeks old. As a blue badge holder and formally registered as severely visually impaired in both eyes, Ben has undergone multiple eye operations in his lifetime at Addenbrookes Hospital, Cambridge. We are incredibly grateful for all the medical care he has received from many specialists over the last 5 years, at not only Addenbrooke’s, but also Moorfields, Hertfordshire, Lister and Great Ormond Street Hospitals. We are also extremely grateful to the VI educational specialist team at Herts Council. 

Ben wears special contact lenses to give him a focus range of  approximately 70cm; without them he can only see light as he has no lenses inside his eyes. Having received specialist care and support throughout his lifetime, Ben’s older sisters, 8 year-old Alice  and 10 year-old Jessica are dedicated to helping their brother and have supported him every step of the way.

Inspired by his sisters, Ben decided to take on a climbing challenge in aid of the Bishop’s Stortford Food Bank to kickstart his school fundraising. Over the weekend Ben visited Clip’n’Climb, Cambridge for the first time, and completed his sponsored climb with Jess and Alice. Encouraged by his sisters and family, Ben climbed to the top of 10 different walls a total of 30 times. Ben’s visual impairment means that a lot of this was done through touch alone.

This challenge was arranged extremely quickly (within a day!) due to current circumstances around Covid19 and possible new lockdown measures on the way. £1035.00 was initially raised on Sunday by family, friends and neighbours for Ben’s climb. We are really glad Ben had the opportunity to climb and we are all so grateful to everyone who has donated money to him. Our local food bank is incredibly important and a very worthy cause, especially right now in these very challenging times. Thank you ever so much. ❤️🧗💪
Title: Ben Hardy's Sponsored Climb

Title: Chantal's Christmas

Description:
Why am I asking for your money?

My wife and children decided to volunteer at the Kingsbridge Area Foodbank at the start of the Covid-19 outbreak. The children are keen participants in the Malborough and District Kids theatre group and the pantos so they have created a song. You can see their customised version of ”Where is love” from Oliver here: youtu.be/qBhFYFel4lw to try and persuade you all to donate some money to the Foodbank's cause. Please watch the video and give whatever you can spare to help support families in need.

Who will receive the money

The Kingsbridge Area Foodbank is a wonderful organisation that has been supporting families and individuals for 8 years but lately the demand for their services has soared to new levels. My wife chose to volunteer with the foodbank, while on furlough from her job in Kingsbridge, and has seen the enormous pressure they are suddenly under. I think the numbers of people being helped have jumped from around 25 to 110 per week. They have already had some very kind donations but, as you can imagine, the demand is using up the money fast. To try and raise money my children came up with the idea of singing a song here so please give it a watch and, if you can, donate to this worthwhile cause.

Why you really should care

I wanted to mention one last thing that has really stuck with my wife. when she visited a family recently. The main earner was self-employed and his business had been forced to stop. As you may know, that means the family will not receive support until June. The lady that answered the door ended up in tears as she explained that she never expected to be in this situation. I have to admit it was very moving to hear her story but thank goodness the Foodbank has been able to help. Please help if you can and if, like the lady above, you find yourself in need, get in touch. There is no judgement, they just want to help.

Thank you and stay safe,

Jason, Tamara, Olly and Charlotte
Title: Charity Song for Kingsbridge Foodbank

Description:
We may not be at school right now, but there are still so many people in need at the moment, and we can try and do our part to support our local community.  You all know that we donate food to Nourish during the harvest time, but there is not a more crucial time to keep showing our support!  So it would be amazing if you could do anything you can, whether that's donating food at the supermarkets (in which case you can look at Nourish's twitter page to see their most needed items), donate some money on here or helping out with vulnerable neighbours by collecting food for them and helping with their shopping.


We may not be able to have a Twggs cake sale, but keep the fundraising going if you can!

Give your best :)
Title: Twggs Charity Fundraising Covid-19

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

As a school we have worked with this incredible charity for some time but over recent weeks and days Nourish have been at the forefront of our minds. 

Many pupils, staff and families from Holmewood House have been wanting to get involved in some way to help our wider community during these difficult and uncertain times of COVID-19.

Nourish is a registered charity that provides short-term emergency provisions, support and signposting in a crisis to individuals and families within the borough of Tunbridge Wells, South Tonbridge and the surrounding areas.

Their  mission is that no-one need go hungry in Tunbridge Wells and the surrounding areas.

We are therefore reaching out to the friends and families of our Holmewood community to invite them to give their support in any way that they can.

Thank you.

We have chosen Nourish as our charity which is a local food bank in Tunbridge Wells.  There are lots of people who will be struggling to feed themselves and their families because they are unable to work because of Coronavirus.

Title: Team Brookbank cycle 260 miles

Description:
My sister and I are taking part in the Hatfield Broad Oak 10k race in support of our local food bank.  As a short, fat, unfit man, I'm not aiming for a time - I just plan on finishing it.

Bishop's Stortford might be an affluent area but there are pockets of deprivation.  Because people often assume everyone this way is well off, help for people in poverty here is limited.  Food poverty is a real thing in our community.  No child should go hungry yet every day they do.  That is why we are running to raise money for the local food bank.

Description:
Amidst the Coronavirus crisis, the people of Milton Keynes are in dire need of our local foodbank more than ever before. Whole families in previously secure jobs have suddenly found themselves thrust into poverty and struggling to put food on the table, through no fault of their own. And the worst is yet to come. 

The foodbank is struggling to meet demand, with food packages going out as soon as the donations come in.

The people of MK need your help now more than ever. I know finances are tight for all of us right now, but please if you can spare even a small amount, you'll be making a big difference right now!

My goal is to cycle 200 miles over the next 30 days, in order to help raise funds, support and feed those in need. Please, let's all chip in to help those who are really in a desperate place right now...
Title: Joe's Cycle 200

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My name is Alice. I am nine years old  and I live in Bishop's Stortford . Like most children I am home from school, this upsets me because it means I can't visit my grandparents in the Easter holidays which I was looking forward to doing. Instead I have decided to virtually cycle to them in April, starting with Nanny in Bishop's Stortford and finishing with Grandmaman and Grandpa in Dorset. This means cycling, on our exercise bike, about 7k every day throughout April to make it up to 206k to reach Dorset by the end of the month. I have decided to do this to keep active and raise money for the Bishop's Stortford food bank, as I feel they will need donations even more so during this outbreak.

Description:
As we are living in the current pandemic and the government restrictions are continuing to severely impact all of us, now is the time we all need to dig deep and keep each other going. Half term is approaching...with social distancing measures in place and play centres closed, it's important to keep ourselves and the kids active and occupied.

This is why I have come up with the idea of ‘Kilometres for our Community’ to keep active and whilst doing so, give something back to those who need it most. The challenge is to complete a run, walk or bike either on your own or with the kids, and donate the distance covered back in pounds. So 1k completed is £1 donated and so on...
Whether you complete 1km or 100km no donation is too small!!

I know that now is not the most ideal of times to be asking for money so I really do mean it when I say no donation is too small.

Let's make it fun! Get out in our wellies/trainees or muddy on our bikes. Lets keep that smile on our faces and more importantly, help towards putting one on those who need us too.

All donations will go directly to this great place, St Andrew's Community Network within our local area, who aim to provide a range of services including a foodbank which is needed now more than ever.

So get your shoes/boots/wellies on and let's get going :-)

Thank you for your time x

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: Donate to South-West Belfast Foodbank

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks

Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 

At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.


We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!


It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.


Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.



Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.


Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.


However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!


Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.

#GreatBritishFast

#fast4foodbanks 


If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.


The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.

.......

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: The Great British Fast

Description:
Feeding Families: Covid-19 Emergency Appeal

The ongoing lockdown is affecting us all, but for many families living in the slums of Kampala it has been devastating.

To meet this crisis, Kids Club Kampala - a small but ambitious and impactful charity, with a small team in the UK, and a team in Kampala employing local Ugandans - are running emergency food banks for vulnerable families to get them through this time.

They have already provided 982,107 emergency food packages, but need further help.

I have joined a collective challenge to run, skip and cycle the distance from here to Uganda along with a bigger team of about a dozen of us. We will be completing 1600 miles in total over a 10 week period. I have pledged to cover 200 miles by the end of August.

Each of us is aiming to raise £300 from our own networks and friends. We really appreciate any of your support especially during this uncertain time for everyone.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Ruthie's page

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks
Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 
At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.

We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!

It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.

Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.


Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.

Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.

However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!

Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.
#GreatBritishFast
#fast4foodbanks 

If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.

The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.
.......
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: The Great British Fast

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Elizabeth's Keep on playing

Description:
While we're all stuck at home, I wanted to do something to put a smile on your face, and raise some money for the Trussell Trust. The national charity's network of food banks are expecting to see an increase in need over the coming weeks as the coronavirus pandemic unfolds.

To help, and hopefully(!) brighten up your day, I am dedicating my mornings to video call as many of you who donate as possible. All you need to do is donate to the Trussell Trust on this page, ensure your phone number is included in your donation, and tick that you are happy to receive further communications so that I am allowed to call you!

By donating, not only will you be in for the chance of a receiving a video call from me, but you will also help people struggling as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. 

Food banks were already seeing an increased need before this outbreak but it's likely that more people than ever will be unable to afford their own food over the coming weeks, especially people who have unstable jobs or who aren't eligible for sick pay, and will need to turn to a food bank for support. 

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust’s network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over half a million of these of these going to children. 

Your donations will help the Trussell Trust support food banks in their network and ensure people in crisis can access emergency food during this challenging time. This money could help fund vans to help food banks deliver food to people's homes, buy food (if necessary and available!), recruit additional staff to meet the demand, but also, vitally, campaign for change so that everyone can afford their own food. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and I look forward to chatting to a few of you over the coming days.

NOW FOR THE LEGAL PART: 

All funds raised will go directly to the Trussell Trust. You can find out more about the organisation on their website www.trusselltrust.org. 

I will try to call as many of you as possible but it might not be possible to speak to everyone who donates. 

Please note that I can only contact you if you provide a phone number and ‘opt in’ to share their details with the Trussell Trust. 

The Trussell Trust is committed to protecting your privacy and will process any personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Act 2018. Your details will be kept safe and secure, only used by the Trussell Trust or those who work for us and will not be shared, sold or rented to third parties for marketing purposes. In this instance, your details (first name, phone number and amount donated), will be shared with Michael McIntyre for the purposes of this fundraising event only.

We may use information you provide for analysis, research or screening purposes in order to help us understand our supporters so that we can save resources and deliver the best possible service.
Title: Michael McIntyre is supporting the Trussell Trust

Title: Supporting FoodBank

Description:
Please join me on the Boxing Day 2019 from Midday for my charity stream to help raise as much money as we can for such an amazing cause.

You can find me at www.twitch.tv/nelinde

If you can't make a donation fear not! You can help by spreading the word and sharing this JustGiving page on social media and with friends and family.


No one should go hungry, especially at Xmas! 

Yet thousands of families are going without food due to poverty, parents going without so their children don't have empty bellies.

This is 2019! This shouldn't even be a thing... Sadly so many people in the UK are in this dire situation. It could be a neighbour or even a family member!

UK Food Banks are vastly overstretched and are in need of food donations more than ever before to meet the highest demands ever to be recorded since the Trussell Trust started in 1999!


But you can help spread a little Xmas cheer <3 


Please spare what you can afford, as little as £2 can afford a single meal!

You can also help by donating any spare "long shelf life" foods such as tinned vegetables etc to your local Food Bank or supermarket Food Bank collection box <3

Having personally relied on my local Food Bank in previous times of hardship I have first hand experience of the effect and contribution Food Banks have on so many people facing financial hardship and not being able to afford food for their families or themselves. They provide a light in times of darkness, often providing much more than just food. 

They offer an ear to listen, a personal connection where there is nothing but loneliness. Many Food Banks even provide clothing that they've had donated. My local Food Bank even run a free playgroup where parents can go to meet other parents and make friendships.

I can't stress how much a small donation can help <3






Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Nelinde's Boxing Day Charity Stream

Description:
I’ve been challenged to do a food eating challenge by friends so I’m hoping to make it into a charitable event to raise some much needed moneys for a well deserved local hospice. 

Myself and chandler are going to be taking on the dreaded “suströming” rotten fermented fish eating challenge. Trust me when I say neither of us are looking forward to attempting this challenge, it is however for a great cause so please please help us help them by donating anything you can to help those who need it the most. 

It’s not going to be easy to watch us both undergo this challenge as most people who’ve attempted this normally get covered in vomit!  Yes vomit, this apparent delicacy is one of the worlds most smelliest dishes so be warned! 

We are both going to donate our stomachs and hopefully raise a decent chunk of money to help this much needed hospice. So please again anything is better than nothing so please dig deep🙏🏻 And share our post to raise awareness and hopefully raise more funds. 

We would both like to thank you for any donations, but don’t wish to thank the friends who have challenged us to do this revolting deed. 

WATCH THIS SPACE xxx

Title: Newton Solidarity fast

Description:
I set this page up for last year's marathon but it was then cancelled and this year's one moved to October. 

Before Christmas 2020 I read a lot about food banks in the UK and found it quite shocking. Not a lot has changed now and so I want to try to raise some more money. There are more people using them than ever in many parts of the country, and the Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of over 1200 food banks. They provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year and during the coronavirus pandemic food banks have seen need rise even further.

I know I have run the marathon before, and I know I have asked for donations before. But this seems like a really worthy cause and an issue that worries me a lot so I hope people will find a few spare quid to donate. I will definitely top up the final total myself too as I feel in a very fortunate to be running the London Marathon and want to complete the race knowing it has also done some good. 

If you are a UK taxpayers and want to sponsor me please tick the Gift Aid box. This enables them to claim an extra 25p per £1 you donate at no extra cost to you. A £10 donation will be transformed into £12.50 and makes a huge difference so please do so. 

Many thanks 

Jeffers

A food pack can cost as little as £10 and can feed a family between 2-4 weeks!!

If you are reading this don't miss this opportunity  to help those in need, grasp it and help with whatever you can!!!! Collectively we can achieve higher, so support me even if its £1 but DON’T stop there, share this with your family and friends, iA we will surpass the target!  Every little helps. Islamic Help is a UK-registered charity delivering sustainable solutions that empower people in need. Our work is underpinned by our core values – honesty, transparency, integrity and accountability.Since launch, we've empowered over 10 million people worldwide.Over the past 17 years, we have provided urgent aid and sustainable relief to thousands of disadvantaged people across the globe, including right here in the UK.

Description:
Growing up in the UK I have been a recipient of free school meals and support from the state. In the current climate we cannot allow the government to abandon the most vulnerable. Let's raise funds for FareShare and support those who need it.

FareShare is the UK’s national network of charitable food redistributors, made up of 17 independent organisations. Together, we take good quality surplus food from right across the food industry and get it to almost 11,000 frontline charities and community groups.
Title: AP fighting food hunger

Description:
The FBN Bank Challenge Team are coming together to walk from London to Lagos (virtually!) before Christmas!  We will cover the 3112 miles (as the crow flies) from our office in London to our Group Head Office in Lagos.  We want to challenge ourselves to stay fit and well during lockdown 2.0, and raise money for a great cause at the same time.  If (when!) we reach Lagos before Christmas, our employer will also make a donation to Refuge.

We chose this worthy cause by inviting nominations for charities from our colleagues and voting for the cause we would like support as a team.  During 2020 we know that domestic violence has sadly increased and we wanted to support a charity that is coping with increased demand on its services during the pandemic.  We hope our efforts will make a small difference to those who are suffering at this time.

One woman in four will experience domestic violence at some point in her lifetime and two women are killed each week in England and Wales by a current or former partner. Refuge supports around 6,000 women & children on any given day, experiencing domestic and sexual violence, female genital mutilation, forced marriage, stalking, trafficking, prostitution & so-called ‘honour’ based violence.By kindly sponsoring the FBN Bank UK team today you are helping to save and change the lives of thousands of women and children escaping domestic violence.Thank you.
Title: FBN Bank UK London to Lagos Walking Challenge

A message from the Zoological Society of Hertfordshire is below:

Love, Mia x


As we go into our second lockdown due to the coronavirus, Paradise Wildlife Park; The Zoological Society of Hertfordshire needs your help & support now more than ever. Your contribution will make an impact, whether you donate £5 or £100. Every little bit helps. For many years, our family-run wildlife charity has connected people with wildlife to inspire a passion for nature. We've built natural habitats for animals under our care, rescued wildlife, and have contributed millions to saving species around the world.Our Mission is to provide our animals with the best possible environment, enrichment, welfare and care, be actively involved in international Endangered Species Breeding Programmes and make substantial contributions to global wildlife conservation projects.We ask you kindly to support us in any way possible, from donations, animal adoptions, animal experiences, fundraising, and spreading the word about the work we do on-site!

I have pledged to raise £500 for Food Packs to ensure that those struggling in the poverty-stricken areas of Tanzania, Pakistan, Bangladesh, the refugees of the Central African Republic and Cameroon, Ethiopia and Somalia, as well as many others, will have enough to sustain their families over the winter period. 

£30 will help provide food to three people around the world, this can last between 2-4 weeks and will help save lives by the permission of Allah (swt). 


Islamic Help will combine your donations with other donations to produce a family food pack, this will be distributed to families in need around the world.

£30 Feeds 3 People
£50 Feeds 1 Family
£100 Feeds 2 Families
£500 Feeds 10 Families
£1000 Feeds 20 Families

In countries where food is cheaper you donations may actually feed more people. The average food packs will last between 2-4 weeks depending on the size of the family and the size of the food pack.


I'm fundraising on behalf of my late father, may Allah SWT have mercy on him ameen. Please donate generously to ensure the campaign can reach as many people as possible Insha'Allah.
Title: Hasina's Food appeal

Description:
Since lockdown in March 2020, many individuals have had the opportunity to work from home, remove their daily commute, throw away the need to buy a meal deal at lunch time and splash out on flat whites.

Of the 900 + individuals I have spoken, many are been delighted to have saved £700 + on average during this time.

So I thought why not share this around as it is a free gift for some, as not everyone has the opportunity to work from home.  Indeed some are not working at all.  

The object of this page, is for us to share those savings with people who are unable to put food on the table this Christmas. 

Fareshare is a brilliant charity that enables this to happen.

Thank-you for your generosity.  Like my page and please share where possible

Paul Nyman

Description:

At Walton Le Dale JFC our team feel very privileged that we have a good meal to eat every day, but we know a great deal of children our age are not as lucky as us. 

Marcus Rashford has inspired us to raise money to help put an end to child food poverty. So members of our team and parents are looking to complete a marathon worth of 5km runs EACH before Christmas to help raise funds for fareshare who’s motto is to fight hunger and tackle food waste.

EVERYONES WELCOME TO JOIN IN! Spread the word and attach your name and pics and we’ll add it to our list of marathoneers!! We may even get 100 marathons out of everyone!!

Title: Banks Methodist School

Description:
If, like us, you are in receipt of a state pension, you will know that at this time of year we receive a ‘winter fuel payment’ from the government of £200  or £300 (depending on age) for each household. This is a lifeline to poorer pensioners, but being neither taxed nor means tested, it also goes to many who do not need it. We wouldn’t describe ourselves as wealthy, but we don’t need the payment to enable us to heat our house through the winter months. 

This year the question feels to us even more acute than usual. Over the past months many people, especially young people, have been losing their livelihoods because of the pandemic, whereas we have had a steady income and have experienced a reduction in our outgoings during lockdown. It feels wrong to be receiving this extra payment from the government whilst others in society are accruing debt and even facing destitution. This is why we thought that this year it would be good to turn our our winter fuel payment into food for those in real need.

The Trussell Trust has a Christian foundation and runs 1200 food banks in its national network. Last year, they provided more than 1.9 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis, and this is predicted to rise by 61% this winter. Two in five of the food parcels go to families with children. Please join us to provide Food for Fuel - if just 25 people donate their £200 we will reach our goal of £5000. Perhaps we can raise even more!
Title: Food for Fuel

CharityName: The Last Night A DJ Saved My Life Foundation
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

During these crazy difficult times it's easy to forget others that are in much worse situation than us. These people can benefit greatly from us sharing our love with them by simply donating whatever we can, even a £. We can't change the world, but we can definitely contribute to making it a better one.
Title: DJ-Jose DSB

Description:
I’ve set myself a challenge to cover 150km running/walking throughout November, raising money for The Salvation Army. 

At Christmas time Children’s Services often receive lots of donations of Christmas  presents for children in need, however, this year won’t quite be the same. I am a Social Worker based in Northumberland working with vulnerable children and families. The Salvation Army support us by donating gifts for the children and young people we work with to ensure parents, who struggle not just at Christmas time, but all year round, can provide their children with presents on Christmas Day.

Due to COVID-19 donations of gifts for children are not as readily accessible or available for the children we work with, making Christmas an even more challenging time. 

A donation of £19 to TSA could provide a box of food and modest gifts for a family in need. If I reach the target of £150, 7 families could be supported this Christmas. 

Of course TSA help people in lots of other ways too....

The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Jane's 150 for The Salvation Army

Title: The Royal London Charity Bingo Night!

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit this fundraising page.

I have been involved with Lifeshare since 2018, a brilliant voluntary organisation established to help meet the needs of homeless and vulnerable people in Manchester and Salford. This year, thanks to the pandemic, most of us are having a virtual work Christmas party so Secret Santa is that bit harder to do. This led to a simple idea...

All those tenners we would normally spend panic buying some bubble bath for that colleague you don't know very well could be better spent this year by a charity. I wondered how much we could raise if we made this simple swap and how much help that would be for a charity like Lifeshare. 

It is estimated that 1 in 154 people in Manchester are homeless and there is currently a plan on the table in Greater Manchester to apply cutbacks worth £2.8m within its homelessness service. 

Through helping out at their breakfast project (serving breakfast each weekend to homeless people in central Manchester) I have seen firsthand how much a warm meal and a drink can go a long way. Why are we using these tenners on lackluster gifts when we could be helping those who really need it? 

The money will go to providing hot food and drinks plus warm clothing to keep homeless people comfortable through the winter. 

I hope you can join me in my mission to raise some cash for this fantastic charity. I cannot imagine being homeless at any time of the year, but it must be so much worse during the winter and at Christmas time. 

You can find out more about Lifeshare's work here: https://www.lifeshare.org.uk/
Title: Manchester's Secret Santa Homeless Fundraiser

Description:
As a new mum in lockdown, walking provides a valuable respite for me. I want to challenge myself to turn this into something that will stretch me, and support others. I have challenged myself to walk 100k over the next month to raise money for Trussell Trust. Why Trussell Trust? Please see their explanation:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange.

Thank you for your support!
Title: Naomi and Nat's 100k Trek for Trussell Trust

Description:
This winter, as well as having to survive the harsh cold, millions of families are also trying to protect themselves from the coronavirus pandemic. 

In recent years, we've seen shocking images of young children who have frozen to death, we never want to see this happen again. Families around the world, especially those who are living in refugee camps and in poorly constructed homes are at greater risk this winter.

Help us give families the support that they need by donating towards our Winter Emergency Appeal.

£15 - Winter Blanket
£30 - Family Winter Food Pack For 2-4 Weeks
£30 - Essential Winter Clothing For 1 Person
£30 - Fuel / Firewood / Gas For Cooking & Heating
£150 - Family Winter Clothing Pack For 5 People
£255 - Provides A Family Winter Survival Pack (Food, Fuel, Blankets And Clothing)

Please note, all donations will go towards our Winter Emergency Appeal fund and will be used to provide families with winter aid. As the needs of each family differ from one region to another, we may use your funds to provide a family with the appropriate winter aid that they require, this may differ from the exact item that you have donated towards.
Title: Amina 's Feed the Hungry

Description:
I am raising money on behalf of my brother who has recently passed way. Please dig deep to provide food for those who are currently struggling.



£10 will help us provide food to one person around the world, this can last between 2-4 weeks and will help save lives by the permission of Allah subhanu wa ta'ala. Give your Zakat here.

Islamic Help will combine your £10 donation with other donations to produce a family food pack, this will be distributed to families in need around the world. 

  • ​£10 Feeds 1 Person
  • £30 Feeds 3 People
  • £50 Feeds 1 Family
  • £100 Feeds 2 Families
  • £500 Feeds 10 Families
  • £1000 Feeds 20 Families

In countries where food is cheaper you donations may actually feed more people. The average food packs will last between 2-4 weeks depending on the size of the family and the size of the food pack. 

Islamic Help are distributing food packs in:

  • ​Yemen
  • Gaza
  • Syrian Refugees
  • Palestinian Refugees
  • Bangladesh

  • Tanzania

Please help me reach my target and donate generously

Thank you

Azmir
Title: Feeding the Hungry on behalf of the Hafiz Abdul Ahad

Description:
We live a privileged life but at the end of our road on The Vineyard is a food bank run by The Trussell Trust that helps families and others in need survive. 

Last year, food banks in The Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With coronavirus, more families than ever are making it hard to make ends meet and the Trust is expecting a 61% increase on last year.

Due to Lockdown, we aren't allowed to travel to climb any mountains right now. Instead we will all climb the equivalent of up and down Ben Nevis in our home in a week (or quicker if we can!). Please sponsor us to help others during this difficult time. No one, especially children, should be left hungry or destitute.
Title: Ben Nevis Lockhart Challenge

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Every poppy makes a difference to the lives of our Armed Forces community.

The Legion has worked with its members, staff, volunteers and partners to create a range of ways for people to get a poppy and show your support in 2020.

Like so many things this year, the Poppy Appeal has to adapt to the threat of Covid-19 and we are asking the you to support us like never before, because every poppy counts.

The Royal British Legion is at the heart of a national network that supports our Armed Forces community.

We're here through thick and thin – ensuring their unique contribution is never forgotten. We've been here since 1921 and we'll be here as long as they need us. 

We are the country’s largest Armed Forces charity, with 235,000 members, 110,000 volunteers and a network of partners and charities; helping us give support wherever and whenever it’s needed.

Find out more about us and the support we provide at:   

https://www.britishlegion.org.uk/about-us/who-we-are

Description:
Hi guys, 

I am planning to cycle 500km within 15 days. We are under lockdown 2.0 and I have Netflix lined up with my Chai. However, it has dawned upon me that there are people that are struggling to put food on the table for their children. Join me in this worthy cause (from the comfort of your home) and bring some warmth to their desperate plight.. 

Your generous funds will be used to buy essential food items that you find readily available in your  kitchen . 

The bike challenge will start on 16 November and finish on 30 November, it is cold out there and my feet and hands are always cold let alone on a bike. Support a brother (out here)!
Title: Ali's 500km in 15 days

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. From November 9th until 6th December  I will be committing to run, walk or row 5k everyday in aid of the YMCA, Raising funds for the emergency food boost appeal. I fully appreciate during these times we all have our own worries however any donation will be greatly received. 

https://www.ymcaexeter.org.uk/i-would-like-to-help/donate/

From the YMCA below 

In response to an increased need and the decline in physical and mental health of some of our young people, we are providing additional food relief during the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic, particularly for those at risk of hunger.

Incorporating another cooking session in the week, separate from our existing community meal, we’re going to be making hot meals throughout the winter and delivering them to our residents. We’ll also be including a menu card for them to replicate healthy meals and including fresh fruit to help build their immunities.

Over the coming months we’ll be purchasing food, fresh fruit, new kitchen equipment and allocating more time each week to run the project.
Title: Louise's 5k everyday for 28 days

Description: In Addlestone, at Christmas, The Salvation Army serves a Christmas Day Lunch for those who would otherwise be on their own, which this year will be delivered to people in their own homes. We also have a Toy Appeal to provide a gift for each child in families that are finding life difficult for any number of reasons; and we provide Christmas food and treat bags for each of these families. The families are referred to us by local schools and social services. Last year we reached out to 150 families and 450 children in this way. If you are able to help us financially that would be amazing and very much appreciated. Wishing you all God's blessings. Addlestone Salvation Army
Title: Addlestone Salvation Army Christmas Toy and Food Appeal

CharityName: World Food Programme - Prism the Gift Fund
Description:
Jo was so many things to so many people - a friend, colleague and relative - and excelled at all of these.  She travelled through life with her own brand of compassion, caring and fun.

So was strong, brave, compassionate, kind, funny and caring.  She always wanted to be a nurse, and excelled at every level, from attaining a prestigious gold medal in her final year, to helping the Red Cross with the crisis in Bangladesh in 1972.  She become one of the first specialist nurses, and was always passionate about nurses pay conditions and rights.  In 1986, she was awarded a Churchill travelling fellowship to look at changes in nurses' conditions of service around the world.

Wherever Jo went...abroad or at home, she was always interested in people, compassionate about their health issues, kind and generous.  During her retirement in Bath she became a custody visitor, helped in the food bank and with the soup run for homeless

Jo was keen that people in crisis were recognised, and asked anyone generous to donate to help support the World Food Programme.  They work to deliver life-saving aid to millions of people living on the edge of survival, alongside community members, restoring job opportunities, building critical infrastructures, and developing education programs.  In fragile settings, every day brings new opportunities and fresh challenges.

On behalf of Jo's family, we thank you for your support
Title: Jo Stockley's page

Description:
At this time of year, I would normally be collecting money for our annual Team Christmas Lunch, sadly this year that is not going to be happening. So, in the spirit of trying to help others who have been less fortunate than ourselves this year, I thought it would be great to do something for a Charity. There are plenty of people who will be going without this Christmas through no fault of their own.

My proposal is that we each donate what we would all normally pay as a Team Christmas Lunch deposit (£10) to The Trussell Trust instead. This is of course entirely voluntary.

I have chosen The Trussell Trust as it is a registered Charity on Just Giving and they provide support to a nationwide network of food banks to provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty. 


Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Cheryl's Food for those in need

Description:
The mission of the Felix Project is simple - to take surplus food from their suppliers and deliver it to any charity that helps feed people. It's all nutritious and would otherwise go to waste. Not only that, but it helps fight food poverty and reduces costs for hardworking organisations.

Maya, Arda, Jess, Carlota, Kelly and Kimberley will be walking 3k a day whether thats rain or shine during the 2nd lock down to raise money and awareness for the Felix Project. We understand that we need to do what we can to support our local communities through these unforeseen circumstances and end food poverty.
Title: SH Girls Walking for Food Poverty

Description:
As longdown strikes again so many people will be plunged into a situation in which their mental health can become very strained. A great outlet for this is exercise and whilst for many that has been stripped away from them, the open road can be a great way to fight back. 

So heres the deal. Donate £5 and I'll enter you to a leaderboard. The person who runs the most miles between now and 2nd December will win a prize. All you have to do is send me a screenshot using any running app and I'll update your mileage daily.
Title: Joe's Miles for Mind Challenge

Description:
Shakil and I will be taking on the Virtual Athens Marathon on Saturday 21st November to support two Charities, mine which is the Trussell Trust and Shakil's which is Cooking Champions. Both these charities aim to reduce hunger in our communities. 

You can follow our journey on Instagram @jkm87_running and @shak_active

Nobody chooses a life that requires support from a food bank, a series of events will have occurred that led them their, some of which some will say are choices but I think in the majority of cases society will have led them down those paths leaving very little real decision making down to the individual. 

However someone got there they deserve support and compassion to help change their future. Having food is a basic human right, not a luxury. Are you aware of just how much support is needed where you live? All may not be as well as it seems. 

What your donation could do:

  • £10 could help give a parent peace of mind that their family
    will not go hungry tonight. 
  • £20 could help support someone take their first
    steps out of poverty. 
  • £50 could help us give more people a place to turn to in
    times of crisis.

If you are unable to support financially right now, that's ok. Maybe you can pick up just one extra thing each time you shop and put it in the collection points, most major supermarkets will have them near the checkouts. That 50p bag of pasta can go along way. 

What they do:

We support a nationwide network of food banks and together we provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

In the UK, more than 14 million people are living in poverty – including 4.5 million children. We support more than 1,200 food bank centres in the UK to provide a minimum of three days’ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred in crisis, as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face. Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in our network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year.

We know it takes more than food to end hunger. That’s why we bring together the experiences of food banks in our network to challenge the structural economic issues that lock people in poverty, and campaign to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Read some stories here on how the trust is supporting those that need it https://www.trusselltrust.org/what-we-do/real-stories/
Title: Jo & Shakil's Athens Virtual Marathon 2020 page

On Saturday 7 November I'm inviting family and friends to join me for virtual food and/or drinks for my virtual Cook Eat Give for Children's Hospice South West. The foodie way to fundraise! Host a virtual Cook Eat Give and raise money with your culinary skills for children with life-limiting conditions and their families. Every meal, however large or small, will make a big difference. Hosting a virtual Cook Eat Give is easy and our fundraising team are still here to help you every step of the way. Simply invite friends and family for a virtual dinner party, each cook a meal of your choice, pair good company with some fun entertainment and all make a donation via your online fundraising page!

Description: National AIDS Trust is the UKs HIV rights charity. We work to stop HIV from standing in the way of health, dignity and equality, and to end new HIV transmissions. Our expertise, research and advocacy secure lasting change to the lives of people living with and at risk of HIV. Rock the Ribbon for World AIDS Day 2020 to help us to stop HIV by 2030, end HIV stigma and support HIV rights. This is an exciting time to take part with a real opportunity to end new HIV transmissions in the UK by 2030. Your support will help us to get to this goal, and be a part of history.

Description:
Babybank Bristol is a children's charity, supporting vulnerable families, babies and young children across the city. Baby Bank's aim is to help alleviate child poverty at a time of financial and emotional stress. The charity distributes pre loved clothes, toys and equipment via a network of social services and midwives, making sure items get to the most in need. 

Babybank has seen a steep rise in demand for services during the pandemic but despite the lockdown they have managed to maintain the service. That said we've seen a significant impact on fundraising efforts, with many usual sources cancelled or on hold. 

I am running 150 miles over 4 weeks so that Babybank can continue to buy much needed new items such as cot mattresses, toiletries and nappies for vulnerable families. 

Please sponsor me! 150 miles over 4 weeks means at least 5 miles a day. It's going to be tough!

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Catherine's 150 miles in 4 weeks

Description:
I want to raise a minimum of £500 for Food Packs to ensure that those struggling in the poverty-stricken areas. Places like Tanzania, Pakistan, Bangladesh, the refugees of the Central African Republic
and Cameroon, Ethiopia and Somalia, as well as many others, will have enough to sustain their families to eat.


But I can’t do this alone, I need your help! The Messenger of Allah (salallaahu ‘alaihi wa sallam)
said, “Whoever feeds a fasting person will have a reward like that of the fasting person,
without any reduction in his reward.”


But it’s not just our duty is Muslims but also as Human Beings to help our brothers and sisters around the world who are in dire need of some of life’s most basic necessities such as food and water, so please donate generously to ensure the campaign can reach
as many people as possible.

Shabanaz
Title: Shabanaz's Feed the Hungry

Description: 2020 has been challenging for everyone, not least the most vulnerable families in our community. Lockdown restrictions and limited resources have meant many families are relying more and more on foodbanks to feed their children. With the seasons changing, we want to do everything we can to ensure no families go hungry this winter. That’s why we are raising funds for the Manchester South Central Foodbank so they can buy enough food to feed the families who need extra support during lockdown. Please donate what you can and help us reach our goal!
Title: ANS's ANS Emergency Food Drive

Description:
Stockport County FC is delighted to announce the launch of its Food for Christmas campaign to provide meals to children in Stockport over the two-week Christmas break.

Following the decision by the UK Government not to provide free school meals over the Christmas holidays it is estimated that 7,500 children in Stockport will struggle to be fed over this period. The Club is aiming to raise the £220,000 needed to provide food vouchers and lift the burden on families at what should be a special time of year.

Club owner, Mark Stott said:

"This is a topic very close to my heart, growing up my mum relied on free school meals for both myself and my sister and it is devastating to think so many families will struggle over the Christmas period. I’d like to thank Marcus Rashford and everyone else who has campaigned and raised awareness on the subject.

We appreciate it’s been a difficult and uncertain time for lots of people this year but I’d like to call on all our fans and corporate sponsors, who find themselves in a more fortunate position to make a donation, anything they can afford, however large or small it all helps towards our goal of giving these families a Christmas to look forward to."

Mark has personally donated £100,000 to the campaign and the Club hopes to raise the remainder through a combination of Club Shop sales, corporate sponsors and donations from fans.

The Club is partnering with local charity Sector 3 to distribute the proceeds. Sector 3 supports individuals, organisations and communities through a multi-faceted suite of support, training, guidance and funding opportunities, enabling organisations to deliver social action on local priorities.

If the government do a u-turn at any point during the campaign the money will be donated to Sector 3 and partners to support families in need within the Stockport area over the Christmas period.
Title: Food for Christmas Campaign

Description:
Every year at Christmas, The Salvation Army in Edinburgh provides toys, gifts and food for families who are in financial difficulty.  These children are mostly referred to us by professional support workers in health care or education settings.  We support, on average, around 300 children each year by providing toys, and around 75 families receive food parcels.  Much of this is only possible because of the overwhelming generosity of the general public.  We usually receive donations of money or toys from individuals, work place collections, store collections, and churches who hold toy services.  

Making a financial gift via Just Giving is an alternative way to make sure that children and families in need will get the support they need this Christmas, in what has been another very challenging year for everyone.  We are grateful for any donations, large or small, that will enable this to happen.  Last year the money raised was able to cover the cost of food provision for every referred local family that needed this support over Christmas.  Thank you.

The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Edinburgh City Salvation Army Toy Appeal 2020

Description:
Christmas should be a magical and exciting time for all, but
for families living in areas of deprivation it stands to be an even more
challenging period.

With this in mind, City in the Community is requesting your
support to do as much as we can to support young people, families, and other
charities supporting people in need.

Together we are stronger; with the support of our staff,
partners, and local businesses we can help to ensure that as many people as
possible across our city love Christmas this year.

100% of the funds raised will go towards providing families
in need with Christmas Day meals and buying special footballs as gifts for
children across Manchester.

44% of children in Greater Manchester are living in poverty,
this equates to 220,000 young people. By providing a three-course Christmas Day
meal for some of these families, we hope that we can help relieve some of the
financial stresses placed on families at this time of year.

1-in-3 children across Greater Manchester are also at risk
of not waking up to a present on Christmas Day, together we can help to change
this for some of those children.

As little as £5 will buy a football gift for a child.

£25 will provide a three-course meal for a family of six on
Christmas Day.

This City loves Christmas. This City loves giving.

Thank you for your support.
Title: Share a magical City Christmas

Description:
Please join Paragon in raising funds for Macmillan by sponsoring our Santa Dash participants! Any sponsorships towards Paragon employees running/walking/jogging around their local area dressed as Santa to raise money for Macmillan are much appreciated!

Macmillan Cancer Support is here to help everyone with cancer live life as fully as they can, providing physical, financial and emotional support. So whatever cancer throws your way, we’re right right there with you.

Description:
The London Ukulele Project's aim is to use music to combat loneliness. We want to help people feel less isolated and lonely during this 2nd lockdown by bringing them together through music all whilst raising money for a great cause. We are so passionate about the ukuleles power to spread joy, build confidence and give purpose, in a time when it is most needed. 

You can see the video here on our YouTube channel https://youtu.be/nEwaCnipw5s

We invited over 70 of our ukulele friends to join us in recording 'Jingle Bell Rock' from the safety of their homes, to help us raise money for The Trussell Trust because this winter, food banks are expecting to give out an emergency food parcel every 9 seconds!

We were so delighted to have contributions from ukulele players all over the world not just in the UK but also Ireland, Germany, USA and even Argentina! Thank you to everybody who took part and thank you for your donations, they are needed now more than ever and no one should go hungry EVER. 

Last year, food banks in The Trussell Trusts network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. With your help #ThisCanChange

The UKSCF is working hard to provide funding to some of the most exciting stem cell research projects. The Foundation has provided funding for research into the treatment of Diabetes, as well as other life-threatening diseases.

Here at The Skinny Food Co, we were born with the intentions of making our products accessible to all lifestyles and diets, including Diabetes. Our directors, James & Wayne, both have family members who suffer from this condition and so they knew the struggle it was to find diabetic-friendly products on the market.
