Description:
Premier Foods have selected Together for Short Lives as their charity partner for 2020-2022. Both organisations share a belief of bringing families together to make moments to treasure. Together, we know we can help families make memories that will last a lifetime by raising vital funds for childrens hospice services across the UK.When a child's life is expected to be short, there's no time to waste. 

Each Christmas e-card you send, Premier Foods will donate £1 to TFSL, in addition to this, you can choose to send an 'e-gift' to the recipient to help support TFSL this Christmas

That might be an hour of care for a poorly child, a contribution to life support equipment, therapy sessions and much more. 



  • A £1 to fund a child’s oxygen mask. 

  • A £5 donation to pay for craft supplies to enable a seriously ill child to express themselves in an art therapy session. 

  • An £8 donation to cover a delicious meal for a family of four receiving respite at a children’s hospice. 

  • A £10 donation to pay for all the ingredients for a yummy mince pie making session – helping children to make a Christmas treat for their families. 

  • A £25 donation to fund one hour of lifeline children’s hospice care for a seriously ill child. 

  • Other donation amount 



Please add your donation to this page.

Description:
Twenty four hours a day, every day of the year. The Salvation Army provide care and support to people in need. In fact its what weve done for over 150 years. It is what we continue to do today and its what we will go on doing whenever and wherever there is injustice and pain in the world.
We help people affected by disasters or financial troubles.  We help people who are experiencing homelessness or escaping violence  We help people trapped in addiction or battling mental illness  We help anyone feeling hopeless.

We are a community- a movement of people fighting injustice. Our donors and supporters- people like you- are as much a part of The Salvation Army as those working in our recovery centres or regional communities. Together we offer unconditional love and support, without discrimination. 

The Salvation Army is committed to delivering innovative and progressive services that empower people beyond their circumstances. Our services are as diverse as the areas of need within the

MDS is raising money for FareShare. FareShare redistribute surplus food to charities to provide meals to over 933,178 vulnerable people in need of food. Description:
The LPT Youth Advisory Board are a group of young people aged 13 to 25 years old who live in Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland. We meet weekly and are passionate about improving and making a difference to the health and well-being of Children and Young people who receive support from NHS and other services.

We feel strongly that all Children and Young people should never go without food, even more so at Christmas time. We would like to raise money to purchase some food packages for Children,  Young people and families in need who receive support from LPT outpatient services for both mental and physical needs. 

These packages will include essential Christmas food items and treats to put a smile on faces after a difficult year. 

From 7th December 2020, we will close the fundraising in order to make these packages and distribute across LPT outpatient services so that the packages reach CYP in time for Christmas! 

Thank you for supporting our fundraiser, every penny counts! If you would like more information or to support us please contact us on FYPCLDGovernance@leicspart.nhs.uk
Title: YAB Christmas Food and Treat package appeal for Children and Young People

Description:
Our fathers, partners, brothers and friends are facing a health crisis, yet it’s rarely talked about. Men are dying too young. We can’t afford to stay silent.

We are the leading charity changing the face of men’s health. We know what works for men – and what doesn’t. Prostate cancer, testicular cancer, mental health and suicide prevention – we’re taking them all on.

Since 2003, Movember has funded more than 1,250 men’s health projects around the world, challenging the status quo, and shaking up men’s health research.
Title: Marks and Spencer Movember - Corby Food Hall

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

So firstly what is the 4x4x48 Challenge?

The 4x4x48 challenge includes running four miles at the top of every four hours, for 48 hours. This will result in running 48 total miles over the course of 48 hours. The 4x4x48 was inspired by retired Navy Seal and ultrarunner David Goggins. In the past, Goggins has described how he uses this workout to train for ultramarathons.

I will use the recently announced lockdown period to train for the specifics of the challenge and aim to start the challenge at 4 am on Thursday the 3rd of December which will run for 48 hours through until Saturday 5th at 00:00

All funds raised will go directly to an amazing charity FareShare who do great work in redistributing surplus food to charities that turn it into meals.

24,074 tonnes of food has been redistributed to charities supporting 933,178 people per week.

Any donation of any value would be greatly appreciated, and would go a long way to helping so many people who could go without this December.

Thanks, Nick
Title: Nicholas's 4x4x48 for Food
